sense.gloss: to descend (e.g. a mountain), to go down, to come down
to alight (e.g. from bus), to get off, to disembark, to dismount
to step down, to retire, to give up, to quit, to fold
to be granted, to be issued, to be given
to form (of frost, dew, mist, etc.)
to be passed (from the body; e.g. of a roundworm)

sdata.j: そんなに↑騒々↑↓そうぞう↓しく↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け|↑下↑↓お↓りる|な。
sdata.e: Don't run down the stairs so noisily.

sdata.j: ↑美↑↓び↓というのは↑山↑↓やま↓の↑頂上↑↓ちょうじょう↓に↑似↑↓に↓ているように↑私↑↓わたし↓には↑思↑↓おも↓われた。そこに↑着↑↓つ↓いてしまえば、また|↑下↑↓お↓りる|↑以外↑↓いがい↓には↑何↑↓なに↓もすることがないのである。
sdata.e: It seemed to me that beauty was like the summit of a mountain peak; when you had reached it there was nothing to do but to come down again.

sdata.j: ↑坂↑↓さか↓を|↑下↑↓お↓りる|ときに↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓のおんぼろ↑自転車↑↓じてんしゃ↓はキーキー↑音↑↓おん↓を↑立↑↓た↓てた。
sdata.e: Her old bike squeaked as she rode down the hill.
